item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodlands Park Road, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Bins overflowing, 3rd October
item.description:
New people have moved into 124 and 124A, but bins are overflowing after not being collected for a few weeks. Foxes are tearing bins pet and rubbish getting out. It will not be long before rats get at this. Lots of young kids in area as opposite school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Horsa Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Damage - smashed glass or panels / jagged metal edges on shelter

item.title: Green waste still not removed, 3rd October
item.description:
Further to my recent posts, the pile of built up green waste at that the back of the small pond ( the one nearest to playground) has still not been removed. The pile over the other side of the park has been but this pile is building up and not being removed. Debris around it also building up again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins taking up half pavement, 3rd October
item.description:
Bins have been on the pavement for weeks. At 20 York avenue. You can only get past one at a time and barely get a pram through. You cannot walk together holding a childâ€™s hand There is plenty of room on the drive to store them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, York Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: Rainwater collects at the edge of the road, 3rd October
item.description:
The entire flat section of new road, either side of the bus stop rainwater collects and passing vehicles spray the pavement. There is no problem with the stormwater drain, road gradient and subsistence mean that rainwater collects and does not flow into the drain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous dumping of domestic rubbish, 3rd October
item.description:
Hi, this happens all the time. Earlier, I sent a report, you kindly dealt with it and emailed to say the issue was resolved. A few hours later, more bags have been dumped! So the root cause isn't resolved, rubbish will continue to be left here. thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped washing machine, 3rd October

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead tree at the bottom of, 46 Ingleton Ave, Welling DA16 2JU, 3rd October
item.description:
There is a large tree at the end of 46 Ingleton Ave, Welling DA16 2JU. This tree has been taken over by ivy, and has died. Pieces of this tree has been falling off for a while. Due to the recent high winds and further predictions of ogj winds. I am concerned that this tree could fall over. The tree is on the boarder of an alleyway that is a public footpath. Due to this the tree could endanger the public, and also if it falls damage property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowper Close, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
